Get Help Now

Immediate support is available 24/7. Find crisis resources, shelter information, and community services in Northumberland County.

Life-threatening Emergency?

Call 911 immediately for police, fire, or medical emergencies

Immediate Crisis

If you're in crisis right now, these resources are available 24/7

Crisis Line

1-866-996-0991

Ontario Mental Health Helpline - 24/7

Text Support

Text TALK to 741741

Crisis Text Line Canada - Free, 24/7

Suicide Prevention

9-8-8

Suicide & Crisis Helpline - 24/7

Tonight Options

Safe shelter and immediate accommodation resources

Emergency Shelter

(905) 555-BEDS

Shelter intake and availability - Call before arriving

Out of the Cold

Winter months only: November 1 - March 31

(905) 555-COLD

Youth Shelter (Under 25)

(905) 555-YOUTH

24/7 intake for youth experiencing homelessness

Women & Families

1-800-265-9178

Assaulted Women's Helpline - 24/7

Non-Emergency Supports

Ongoing resources and community connections

Contact IHARC

(905) 555-HELP

info@iharc.ca

Monday - Friday, 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM

211 Ontario

2-1-1

Comprehensive information about local services

ConnexOntario

1-866-531-2600

Mental health & addiction services information

Integrated Homelessness & Addictions Response Centre serving Northumberland County with comprehensive support and community safety initiatives.
